page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: For hundreds of years Normanton was a small farming settlement situated on high ground between two tributaries of the river Calder,Ashfield beck in the north and further south Wain Dike Beck.296 people lived here in 1821.In 1834 the railway came to Normanton establishing the town as an important railway junction and only stopping point midway between the capital cities of London and Edinburgh. Coal mining had existed for many years but in the 1860's this activity increased.The railway and mining activities transformed the rural village into a town. In(1895 the Normanton Urban)produced the Towns Coat of Arms,which depicts the industries of the day(Farming,Railway,Coalmining).
